job_description: Quantitative Analyst / Data Scientist - job post Citi 19,181 reviews Irving, TX $89,620 - $134,430 a year -  Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $89,620 - $134,430 a year Job Type Full-time Summary: The Model Analysis Group (MAG) is a growing team within Risk Modeling and Analytics (RMA) . It is responsible for all post model development analytics related to models developed by RMA teams, including Ongoing Performance Assessments (OPA), Annual Model Reviews (AMR), and Revalidations. Members of the MAG will be actively involved in different aspects of the model lifecycle. A typical model goes through different stages: design, calibration, testing, documentation, validation, implementation, monitoring and back to re-design and re-calibration when relevant assumptions change or monitoring indicates performance issues. OPAs and AMRs are critical stages of the model lifecycle to determine model performance (model use and monitoring) that can trigger model re-design or re-calibration by identifying critical issues. Thus the job is related to a critical stage/decision point; essentially whether or not the model can still be used, which in turn has a material impact on resources, timelines, and deliverables. Key mandates also include driving productivity enhancements in Model Analysis through innovation. The MAG will leverage cutting edge software and technology to reimagine the way we currently execute on this crucial phase of the model lifecycle, to the benefit of our partners, including model sponsors, developers, and Model Risk Management. As the MAG spans all RMA models, members of the MAG will have the opportunity to become well-versed in multiple risk stripes, with such skills training enhancing their mobility and growth potential within RMA and the larger Risk organization. The position will work very closely with others in the MAG, including the Head of MAG who reports to the head of RMA. RMA develops risk analytics for use by Risk, Finance and Product and Client Coverage teams on a global basis. The head of RMA reports to the Finance Chief Risk Officer. Key responsibilities: Stakeholders include various working groups, model developers, risk managers, business clients, model validators, internal and external auditors, and regulators. Engage with stakeholders accordingly to: Develop and implement methodologies, algorithms and diagnostic tools for testing model robustness, stability, reliability, performance and quality control of modelling data. Conduct on-going model performance analysis (OPAs), annual model reviews (AMRs) , and revalidations. Discover, understand and quantify model limitations Provide comprehensive interpretations, explanations and conclusions Work with partners to resolve model issues Enhance efficiency and effectiveness of implementation of post model development analytics. Automate and consolidate ongoing model analysis and the annual model review process across different models Migrate analytics to a production environment as appropriate Support various tasks in response to regulatory and internal risk management requirements. Develop, maintain and enhance technical documentation including project plans, model descriptions, mathematical derivations, data analysis, process and quality controls. Education: A PhD or Master’s in a technical discipline ( e.g. physics, mathematics, statistics, engineering, economics, financial engineering, operational research or similar). Qualifications: 4+ years of experience in a comparable quantitative modeling or analytics role, ideally in the financial sector. Fewer years of experience will be considered with advanced degrees. Postdoctoral researchers are encouraged to apply. Solid programming skills and experience with statistical data analysis, modelling techniques and numerical implementations. More specifically experience in Python Data Science Stack (NumPy, SciPy, Pandas, Scikit-Learn, Jupyter and IPython), R, Shell Scripts, UNIX, VBA, C/C++ (basic knowledge), SAS, Version Controlling (Git/Bitbucket) and basic database skills in either Oracle or Sybase/SQL .You may at least have experience in three of these techniques. Experience in developing and maintaining detailed technical documentation for models, model validation, project plans and processes preferred (Experience in scientific research paper writing will be an added advantage ). Strong written and verbal communication skills, and ability to discuss technical issues with stakeholders. Ability to meet deadlines for product deliverables in a timely, proactive and entrepreneurial manor. Demonstrated project management and organizational skills and capability to handle multiple projects at one time. - Job Family Group: Risk Management - Job Family: Risk Analytics, Modeling, and Validation - Time Type: Full time - Primary Location: Irving Texas United States - Primary Location Salary Range: $89,620.00 - $134,430.00 - Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. Outcomes Analyst III - job post Concentra 2,612 reviews Addison, TX 75001 Full-time Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Overview: Please be advised, if you are viewing this position on Indeed, that the salary rate/range set forth herein was provided by Indeed. Concentra's market specific rate/range will be provided during the interview process. POSITION SUMMARY: The Outcomes Analyst III position will support the reporting and analytical responsibilities within the Clinical Analytics department. Analyst will be responsible for all aspects of employer and clinical reporting and analyses, from determining data acquisition and manipulation to final reporting including comprehensive analysis of results, trends, and outcomes. Analyst will also be accountable for special projects, as needed. Responsibilities: THE DETAILS Complete utilization analyses to support clinicians: evaluate practice patterns, trends, outliers and opportunities lending insight to practice patterns or variation in outcomes statistics Generate standard reports (daily, monthly/quarterly) to support work comp utilization and reporting Develops and executes on low to medium level projects to implement solutions for reporting with frequent management input and supervision; while elevating issues to management when needed Complete utilization analyses to support external customers: evaluate clinicians' practice patterns and outlier metrics to explain alignment or deviation from clinical model Identify opportunities to improve, document and/or train others on reporting processes and procedures to gain efficiency and productivity Work with internal departments to customize reports/analyses for presentations and client meetings Contribute to UAT/Quality testing for new reports/dashboards and enhancements to outcomes system database (EDW) This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice. SCOPE MEASURES Direct reports: No Indirect reports: No Budget responsibility: Not applicable Qualifications: EDUCATION/CREDENTIALS Bachelor’s Degree in Analytical Science, Math, Computer Sciences, Economics, or related field from an accredited college/university. Graduate degrees (Masters and/or Doctorate) are required if job related experiences do not meet the minimum years of experience requirement JOB-RELATED EXPERIENCE Customarily four or more years of analytical and technical application experience (healthcare experience is a plus) Must have the ability to assess a request to understand the client’s needs, use technical tools (such as SQL, MicroStrategy, Excel, etc.) to retrieve, cleanse, and analyze data, identify and understand impact of clinical practice patterns, and present results in a meaningful written dialogue with visuals created from technical applications (such MS Office). JOB-RELATED SKILLS/COMPETENCIES Concentra Core Competencies of Service Mentality, Attention to Detail, Sense of Urgency, Initiative and Flexibility Ability to make decisions or solve problems by using logic to identify key facts, explore alternatives, and propose quality solutions Outstanding customer service skills as well as the ability to engage with people in a manner displaying tact and professionalism The ability to properly handle sensitive and confidential information (including HIPAA and PHI) in accordance with federal and state laws and company policies Working knowledge of Microsoft Applications and other applications Effective analytical and problem-solving skills Proven database experience t(SQL) to manipulate large data sets for analyses Demonstrated ability to effectively manage projects and present information professionally and effectively to various individuals, groups, and others Excellent interpersonal and communication (both verbal and written) skills Ability to meet deadlines and be flexible when priorities are re-assessed Additional Data: Benefits 401(k) with Employer Match Medical/Vision/Prescription/Dental Plans Life Insurance/Disability Paid Time Off/Holidays Colleague Referral Bonus Program This job requires access to confidential and sensitive information, requiring ongoing discretion and secure information management. Concentra is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability/veterans If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.
